newsitem.title: FRANCE: TMA hopes for ex-Paris cargo service by end-Sept.
newsitem.headline: TMA hopes for ex-Paris cargo service by end-Sept.

text.p: Lebanese cargo airline, Trans Mediterranean Airways (TMA), said it expected to resume freighter services from Paris to Beirut by end-September.
In August, TMA did not operate any flights from Orly following a management decision in Beirut to restructure the airline, a Paris-based TMA cargo official told Reuters.

"Restructuring has now been completed and while we have received no official word, a relaunch of flights from Orly to Beirut is probable between September 20 and the month-end with the same twice-weekly frequency using Boeing 707Fs."
TMA is also considering creating other cargo stations in France at Chateauroux, Lyon and Marseille, the official added. - Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax+44 171 542 5017
